title: Innovative 6-port hub also offers iPad stand and even media controls
description: The Zagg 6-port hub and Pro dock hold up your iPad or MacBook while adding a variety of useful ports. Zagg just launched other new hubs, too. (via Cult of Mac - Apple news, rumors, reviews and how-tos)
author: Ed Hardy
excerpt: The Zagg 6-port hub and Pro dock hold up your iPad or MacBook while adding a variety of useful ports. Zagg just launched other new hubs, too.
text: News The Zagg 6-Port Media Hub is ideal for fans of watching video on an iPad. Photo: Zagg Don’t buy a separate stand and hub for your iPad until you check out the Zagg 6-port Media Hub that launched Wednesday. Add an HDMI port, a USB-A port and more to your tablet without taking up any more space on your desktop than a stand alone would. Plus, it got a big brother: the Zagg Pro Dock is a stand for MacBooks with 10 ports, including dual HDMI and Ethernet. These are part of a collection of new hubs from Zagg with a range of port options. Zagg 6-Port Media Hub for iPad Put the Zagg 6-Port Media Hub on your desktop, flip open the stand, place your iPad in the slot, and you’re ready to enjoy a movie. Across the front are a set of media controls that make starting, stopping and jumping through video or audio a snap. For more enjoyment, plug a large screen into the HDMI port that supports 4K at 60Hz. There’s a 3.5mm audio jack for speakers. Or use the hub to get to work. It offers a USB-A port for accessing legacy accessories and a USB-C port to keep the iPad charged. There are also paired SD and microSD card readers. When you’re finished, the whole ensemble folds to be portable. The Zagg 6-Port Media Hub launched Wednesday at $99.99. But that’s only the start. A “satellite hub” adds two HDMI ports, a USB-C port, and an Ethernet port. The separate hub allows these cables to be hidden away. A 150-watt power supply provides plenty of juice for the MacBook and all the attached accessories. The Zagg Pro Dock also launched on Wednesday. It costs $399.99. Buy it from: Amazon For a serious setup ZAGG Pro Dock Create a whole digital ecosystem with the ZAGG Pro Dock. The stand holds your laptop or tablet, and its nine ports allow you to plug in USB-C and USB-A devices as well as additional screens, ethernet, and audio accessories. It even has an SD card reader for additional memory. The Pro Dock also lets you access 150W of power so you can charge your attached devices. Pros:MacBook stand and dock in oneNine ports for accessories Zagg 4-Port Hub and 9-Port Hub too But wait, there’s more. This accessory maker also introduced the 4-Port Hub with Wireless Charging. It offers two USB-C ports (one with PD), a USB-A port, and an HDMI port that supports 4K at 60 Hz. The hub also boasts 100W pass-through charging. And don’t overlook the 10W wireless charger for your phone built into the top. The ZAGG 4-Port Hub is available now for $89.99. Buy it from: Amazon And don’t overlook the Zagg 9-Port Hub. It offers two USB-C ports (one with 20W of power and 10Gbps data transfers), two HDMI ports (one at 60Hz 4K, one at 30Hz 4K), a USB-A port, SD and microSD card readers, an Ethernet port and a 3.5mm audio jack. The accessory handles up to 100W of pass-through power. The aluminum chassis is designed to be portable, and the integrated USB-C cable folds flush with the case. Don’t buy a separate stand and hub for your iPad until you check out the Zagg 6-port Media Hub that launched Wednesday. Add an HDMI port, a USB-A port and more to your tablet without taking up any more space on your desktop than a stand alone would.

Plus, it got a big brother: the Zagg Pro Dock is a stand for MacBooks with 10 ports, including dual HDMI and Ethernet.

These are part of a collection of new hubs from Zagg with a range of port options.

Zagg 6-Port Media Hub for iPad

Put the Zagg 6-Port Media Hub on your desktop, flip open the stand, place your iPad in the slot, and you’re ready to enjoy a movie. Across the front are a set of media controls that make starting, stopping and jumping through video or audio a snap. For more enjoyment, plug a large screen into the HDMI port that supports 4K at 60Hz. There’s a 3.5mm audio jack for speakers.

Or use the hub to get to work. It offers a USB-A port for accessing legacy accessories and a USB-C port to keep the iPad charged. There are also paired SD and microSD card readers.

When you’re finished, the whole ensemble folds to be portable.

The Zagg 6-Port Media Hub launched Wednesday at $99.99.

Buy it from: Amazon

Zagg Pro Dock for MacBook

Zagg calls the new Pro Dock a “game-changer for serious professionals.” It’s a stand for a MacBook with two USB-C ports, two USB-A ports, an SD card reader and a 3.5mm audio jack in the base. But that’s only the start. A “satellite hub” adds two HDMI ports, a USB-C port, and an Ethernet port. The separate hub allows these cables to be hidden away.

A 150-watt power supply provides plenty of juice for the MacBook and all the attached accessories.

The Zagg Pro Dock also launched on Wednesday. It costs $399.99.

Buy it from: Amazon

For a serious setup

ZAGG Pro Dock

Create a whole digital ecosystem with the ZAGG Pro Dock. The stand holds your laptop or tablet, and its nine ports allow you to plug in USB-C and USB-A devices as well as additional screens, ethernet, and audio accessories. It even has an SD card reader for additional memory. The Pro Dock also lets you access 150W of power so you can charge your attached devices.

Pros:

  • MacBook stand and dock in one
  • Nine ports for accessories

Zagg 4-Port Hub and 9-Port Hub too

But wait, there’s more. This accessory maker also introduced the 4-Port Hub with Wireless Charging. It offers two USB-C ports (one with PD), a USB-A port, and an HDMI port that supports 4K at 60 Hz. The hub also boasts 100W pass-through charging. And don’t overlook the 10W wireless charger for your phone built into the top.

The ZAGG 4-Port Hub is available now for $89.99.

Buy it from: Amazon

And don’t overlook the Zagg 9-Port Hub. It offers two USB-C ports (one with 20W of power and 10Gbps data transfers), two HDMI ports (one at 60Hz 4K, one at 30Hz 4K), a USB-A port, SD and microSD card readers, an Ethernet port and a 3.5mm audio jack. The accessory handles up to 100W of pass-through power.

The aluminum chassis is designed to be portable, and the integrated USB-C cable folds flush with the case.

The Zagg 9-Port Hub can be purchased now at $149.99

Buy it from: Zagg
